02 Pity Vote for an Old Pitty?

Duke is a longtime participant in this contest. He's almost 13 now. He has a perpetual old man cough. He snores. We think he had a stroke, and now he sags to the left. He's at least three-quarters deaf (that's actually an advantage when you live with a baby). We still love him and think his snowy face is very cute. Duke hopes that the rest of DHR feels the same!

Submitted by: Carolyn Zemanian

Votes
Email

03 Enjoying Retirement!

After many years of competition and unrealized dreams of cuteness, Henry has decided to sit this one out and enjoy a life of leisure, relaxing on the couch and watching cat videos. I'll say that he seems a little sad not to have ever been named "DHR's Cutest!", but he's a "tough" pittie from the streets of Richmond and would never admit that he has a soft side. Could this year be different??

Submitted by: Roger Kirchen

Votes
Email

05 The Queen of Bryan Park

A perennial favorite of the cute pets contest but never quite takes the well-deserved crown. She's now getting up there in age (and so is her mother!). Please vote for this sweet pup with the beautiful eyes!

Submitted by: Jennifer Pullen

Votes
Email

06 Two retired racers

My two children, pumpkin and peanut! They were both racing greyhounds in Florida and West VA respectively and are enjoying their lazy retirement here in RVA. We rescued them from an agency called James River Greyhound! Pumpkin is 9 years old and Peanut is 6; they both retired at 3 years old and we have had them ever since. Their favorite activities include laying down, eating, and laying down some more.

Submitted by: Troy Baker

Votes
Email

07 Merry Christmas

Sylvester was found in a box on the side of the road with all his siblings in 2020 and made his way to the Andrews home the same day. He was only a couple of days old and barely had his eyes opened. Now he is the alpha cat in the house, thinks he's human sometimes, gets away with things the others don't (last cat syndrome) and loves to pose for pictures.

Submitted by: Jennifer Andrews

Votes
Email

08 Peekaboo

Woowoo giving his best impression of a stack of plates and startling his mommy when she opens the cabinet door.

09 Nightly Storytime

Dottie never misses bedtime reading of Harry Potter with her favorite little boy

Submitted by: Summer Louthan

10 I Wuv U

My name is Magnolia. But, everyone calls me Maggie. Rod Stewart fans call me Maggie May. For some reason, whenever I settle into a nap, they start singing at me to "Wake up Maggie." Very annoying! When you come to visit me I will bring you all of my special toys and we can play fetch. If you sit in one of my favorite chairs, I will climb up on the back, sit on your shoulder and give you kisses on your ear. I do Wuv U!

Submitted by: Elizabeth Lipford

Votes
Email

11 Dishwasher Dog

So, I have a bad habit of eating mushrooms in my yard and on the side of the road...anywhere really. And because of that my owners have had to spend about a billion dollars in vet bills. Now, I am on a special diet with supplements, probiotics, clay powder and sometimes acupuncture because I ruined my GI tract with the toxic mushrooms. Something about helping my gut microbiome. The only treats I get are apple slices and I have lost like 8 pounds. I am always hungry. When no one is looking, I try to lick the dishes in the dishwasher. My mom looks the other way, but my dad gets upset. I try to do it quickly when no one is looking. But I have to admit the bits of food off the dishes are nothing compared to the mushrooms. If I win, maybe it could help pay for me to go to a doggie mushroom detox center?

Submitted by: Wendy Musumeci

Votes
Email

12 The Magnificent MoMo

I can't believe they haven't dropped anything on the floor yet. How can they eat bacon right in front of me like that?

Submitted by: Sherry Teal

DHR Cute Pets 2025

Voting is open to DHR staff from 12/1-12/4 at 4:30PM. Each vote = $1 pledged with no limits. Vote for many pets! Come back as often as you like! You will receive a summary of pledges at the end of the contest. You must be logged into your COV account to vote or see results.
